author: jimmygchen
content:
The main thing that we rely on supernode doing are these, ordered by importance IMO
- distributed blob publishing to help propagation and support high blob count
- reconstruction to ensure data availability (with #1 functional, this is less frequently used)
- serving rpc data

The number of super nodes mainly benefits #3 above, but i don't believe there's high reliance on them serving data on a large network - we should also avoid that as much as we can. For #1 and #2 we just need *some* supernodes to be available. So Im not sure if there's much benefit to add accountability.

For high stake node, I also don't believe there's much incentive to do that - reducing bandwidth usage while sacrificing security (the more columns they custody, the harder for them to get tricked into voting for an unavailable block)

author: jimmygchen
content: it's hard for me to imagine a large entity running < 5 nodes. "number of validators per node" may not be accurate because i believe most professional setup would have validators connected to more than one node.
